page.title: 02Farming
page.content: On the better drained lands around Frieth most of the land is arable. The predominant crop is barley though some wheat is being grown. Other fields are used for hay or silage. Down in the valley and on the lower slopes much of the land is pasture land, mainly grazed by dairy cattle. In the higher part of the valley around Turville, arable land is more prominent, including a large acreage of rape. Below Frieth a small herd of Highland cattle was grazing rough pasture. Started as a hobby, and to help keep the grass down, the herd has grown because the cattle bred so well. Economically not profitable, although producing good beef, butchers are loathe to handle them, and so offer low prices. Farming is highly mechanised and so the labour force is small.
